faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Ethics and morality. Essence of business ethics. Ethical theories. Models of ethical decision making. Ethics at workplace. Ethics and organization. Ethics and consumers.
description.et: Eetika olemus ja ajalugu. Moraal. Ärieetika olemus. Teleoloogia ja deontoloogia. Eetilise otsustamise mudelid. Eetika ja töö. Eetika ja ettevõte. Eetika ja tarbijad.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is explaining the nature of ethics theories and giving an overview of main ethical dilemmas and issues experienced in business.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade peamistest eetikateooriatest ning ettevõtte tegevuse käigus esilekerkivatest eetilistest dilemmadest, nende põhjustest ja lahendamisvõimalustest.

learning_outcomes.en: - Knows to essence of main ethical theories applied in the field of business ethics
- Is able to analyze the core differences of the theories
- Knows how to specify ethical dilemma and is able to analyze the reasons behind ethical dilemmas that occur in business situations
learning_outcomes.et: - Oskab määratleda eetilist dilemmat või probleemi ning oskab näha ettevõtte tegevuses tekkivate dilemmade põhjuseid.

learning_outcomes.en: - Is able to identify (and prevent if possible) ethical issues in organizational performance
learning_outcomes.et: - Oskab ära tunda (võimalusel vältida) ettevõtte tegevuses esinevaid eetilisi probleeme.

learning_outcomes.en: - Is qualified to analyze ethical issues in the framework of ethical theories
learning_outcomes.et: - On võimeline analüüsima eetilisi probleeme tuginedes eetikateooriate seisukohtadele.

learning_outcomes.en: - Is able to explain why the particular decision is ethical or unethical.
learning_outcomes.et: - Oskab argumenteeritult selgitada langetatud otsuste ja lahenduste eetilisust või ebaeetilisust.

independent_work.et:
List of assignments:
Two  assignments (individual and group). 
Instructions about the assignments will be provided in Moodle.

description.et:
Home assignment No 1. Individual 
Grading: 20 points /11 points minimum required

Home assignment No 2. Group assignment. 
Grading: 30 points /16 points minimum required
Participation in seminars. Each seminar will give 5 points as max. 15 points as total possible. Participation in all three seminars are mandatory (weeks 27, 29, 31)

Written test in the classroom (45 minutes)
Grading: 35 points as max (18 points as minimum required).

grade_preconditions.et:
1. Two home assignments were submitted: 
1.1. If the home assignment is not submitted timely, it will be graded with 0 points and this means that final grade will be "failed."
1.2. If the student does not get points over the minimum level set, resubmission is allowed once. 

2. Participation in the seminars:
2.1. Participation in 3 seminars is mandatory! Absences from the seminars will only be accepted if agreed upon with the lecturer in advance and justified (e.g. medical certificate). 
2.2. Students need to prepare for the seminar (learning guidelines are provided in moodle)
2.3. Participation in lectures is highly recommended; additional topics will be discussed in the lectures, and that material can be included in the test.

3. A written test will be in the classroom. The test combines multiple-choice questions and essay-type questions. 
Two dates are scheduled for the test; preregistration in the study information system is required at least 3 days before the test. 


IMPORTANT: It is not allowed to use any materials in the test (incl AI)

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade will be formed based on the following criteria:
1) Points from the home assignments. A positive final grade is only possible if all assignments are submitted on time and both assignments are graded at least with the minimum score required.
2) Points from the seminars (15 as max); 
2) Points from the written test: max 35 points, at least 18 points from the test. 

Final grade: 61% and more-passed; below 61% - failed
